cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn NNW tonight then NNE on Wednesday, tracking toward the Florida Big Bend, crossing inland across southeastern Georgia and South Carolina, and then emerging offshore into the western Atlantic.

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast from Tampa Bay northward through the Big Bend, then inland across southern Georgia and southeastern South Carolina including the Port of Charleston, before moving offshore toward the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic coast.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (peak 40–45 mph) are possible late Thursday into Friday with a 22 % cumulative chance of 34-kt winds and only a 5 % chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–3 ft above normal tides possible along the South Carolina coast as the center passes inland, but values above 3 ft are not currently expected at Charleston.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches widespread with locally higher totals above 4 inches possible as the system moves across the state Thursday night into Friday, producing localized flooding in low-lying port areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes/waterspouts are possible in outer rain bands as the center approaches and passes.
